isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES: SPICER S100-S, S105-S, S135-S, S150-S - INSTALL - RING GEAR AND PINION TOOTH CONTACT PATTERN

svcproc.title: RING GEAR AND PINION TOOTH CONTACT PATTERN

figure.caption: Figure 30. Ring Gear and Pinion Tooth Contact Pattern

svcproc.para: The following procedures are to be used to establish proper gear tooth pattern after assembly of the carrier is complete.

note.para: If matched sets are being reused, measure and record backlash before disassembly, and reassemble to the same backlash. This will match ring and pinion gears to the established wear patterns. Hand rolled patterns will cover less area than the wear pattern established by previous service.

step1.para: Paint 1/4 ring gear with marking compound on both the drive and coast side.
Rotate ring gear at least one complete revolution in both directions while load is being applied.

note.para: Tooth contact pattern can be moved only by adjusting backlash. The tooth contact pattern can be moved in the direction of heel-to-toe, and toe-to-heel; depth of the pattern cannot be adjusted. If an acceptable tooth contact pattern cannot be established within limits of backlash, contact International either by opening a Case File in Tech. Central, or by contacting a TSM.
